intro.description:
Welcome to the FeatureIDE tutorial.
This tutorial will help you to build your first FeatureIDE Project. After you have finish this tutorial, you will have a simple Hello World software product line.
The first step for your product line is the domain engineering. Here you have to think about, what features you provide for your product. For further information about software product lines engineering use the help button. This picture will show you the basic idea between domain engineering and application engineering.
Let's get started!

item.title: Open the FeatureIDE Perspective
item.description: Change the perspective to the FeatureIDE Perspective. You can use the Button on the upper right corner of the Workbench. You can click the "Click to Perform" button to have the "FeatureIDE" perspective opened automatically.

item.title: Create a new FeatureIDE Project
item.description: First you have to create a new Project. You can find the FeatureProject Wizard under File-> New. You can also click "Start Wizard" to start the Wizard. In the wizard use the Ahead as the Composition Tool. On the next page you have to choose a Project name. For example "HelloWorld".

item.title: Edit the feature model
item.description: Now its time to create a feature strutured tree to implement your features.

subitem.label: Open the model.m file. You will see a new Editor where you can create a feature structured tree for your software product line.
First create two additional layers under your root featur. Right Click on the feature "Hello World" and click "Create new Layer" twice. Rename the new feature "Hello", the other "World".

Right Click on the unnamed feature and select "Create new Compound". You will get a Compound above with a different color. Now select the Compound Node and rename it to "Feature". After that create a additional layer below. Rename the child features to "Wonderfull" and "Beautiful".

Connections between feature and its group of children are distinguished as And (no arc), Or- (filled ar) amd Alternative-groups (unfilled arc). The children of And-groups can be either mandatory (filled circle) or optional (unfilled circle). Click on the help button, to see how your tree might be look like.
Double click on the connection of the feature "Wonderful" and change it to a Alternative group. Then right click on the "Feature" and uncheck the option mandatory.

item.title: Create new Jak-Files

subitem.label: Now create more Jak Files. Create one in the directories "Beautiful", "Wonderful" and World. But in these cases you should activate in the Wizard the Option "Refines". All the Jak File must have the Name main.

item.title: SourceCode for the jak-Files
Equation File
item.description: After you design your feature model, you have to create a new Equation File. You can use the New Equationfile Wizard.

subitem.label: Open the EquationFile. Here you can select the features you want to activate for your software product line. After you have select some Items, FeatureIDE will compose your features to one executable java file.

item.title: Start your application
item.description:
Now itÂ´s time to start your application. Choose run configuration from your toolbar. In the next window create a new Layered Application.
Browse to your Project and your Main Class. Now you can click on the run button and enjoy your very nice Hello Beautiful Wonderful Word application!
